Reviews.Title: “Older property that tries to be excellent and falls short”
Reviews.Author: cariboukb
Reviews.Content: We should have been concerned when we had to be buzzed into the property at 10 p.m. on a Sunday night, and even more concerned when there was a security guard on foot patroling the parking lots. But hey, it's Southern California. Overall, the property is in good repair, but, it is showing signs of age. The breakfast is usual fare, and the evening receptions are very disappointing - I was traveling with a colleague that is a Vegan, and there was nothing that she could eat except for a poorly put together ice burg salad. Internet connectivity is poor at best. The highlight of the week here was the staff that drove our daily shuttle (our business meetings were in VanNuys). They were courteous and always on time when we requested a pick up.

Reviews.Title: “When in the S.F. Valley, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: HermanTheGerman-inTX
Reviews.Content: A personable and friendly staff greets you at the front desk and fulfills requests for information and service with a smile. Suites are spacious and well equipped - especially the kitchen. I hear that extensive room renovations are planned for April and May, one building at a time, so not to interfere with guest's experience. A good hot breakfast served in the main house. Clean pool and lounges, along with a large outdoor patio. Convenience store, Starbucks and a Deli in walking distance. Gocery store and several restaurants near by (by car). Easy access to the 118-Freeway. BUR airport about 30 minutes drive.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jelico8
Reviews.Content: The employees we encountered were all nice and helpful. The room itself was clean and spacious. Water pressure was great. The light housecleaning met our needs. The pool and hot tub were clean and great after a long day on the town. The free breakfast buffet was extension and tasty. Parking was a bit of a pain, as the spots were really close and a lot of people double parked, but besides that, the location worked for us and we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for the price.”
Reviews.Author: AS584
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the oldest properties in the Staybridge system; buffet breakfast was unappealing; service was below average; and the shower water was cold in our room. We ended up moving to another IHG affiliated property the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and best hotel suites in North LA”
Reviews.Author: punacoast
Reviews.Content: If you like Trader Joeâ€™s or Whole Foods, then Staybridge Suites is the hotel that you should stay at in Chatsworth. Itâ€™s only 5 minutes away from these markets! Itâ€™s also conveniently located just a few blocks from Hwy 118 and Reseda Blvd where youâ€™ll find all the shopping malls and restaurants. We always stay at this hotel whenever weâ€™re in north LA for business. The 2-bedroom 2-bath suite is large and very comfortable, with nicely decorated livingroom and a fully equipped kitchen (flat top stoves, microwave, dishwasher, sink, cooking wares, dishes). We love the kitchen because we enjoy making meals with all the good foods from Trader Joeâ€™s! The beds are big with plenty of pillows and clean sheets. The thick curtains keep the bedrooms in pitch-black darkness, great for sleeping! In fact, itâ€™s so dark that we have to plug in a small night light (we always travel with one) so we donâ€™t walk into walls trying to find the bathroom in the middle of the night! We also like the free high speed internet (youâ€™ll need a passcode from the very helpful front desk staff to connect) and free parking. Not sure why but the parking spaces in front of our suite are all tiny (as in everywhere else in CA we noticed!), our compact rental car can barely fit in!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: FreyShay
Reviews.Content: What a great place! All the staff was extremely courteous and professional. It was great to have a separate bedroom and living area. We will definitely remember this hotel chain for future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: plato1234
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, and then it was very good but not excellent. This time we really found it excellent, from the cleanliness of the room, to the quality of the morning breakfast to the friendliness of the staff. Also the price was very good and having a separate bedroom a great plus. We booked online but through the Fat Wallet portal for an additional discount.. The dishes and glasses were clean in the small kitchen and we especially loved the pool which was spotless and very relaxing in the mid day 113F weather. The jacuzzi was just to hot for the weather however. The business centre was equipped with new PCs and a great high speed laser printer which we used to print our boarding passes before leaving. The custom package on the PC makes it easy to clear the cache when you are finished browsing. Also WIFI in the room is fast. Our room was in the main building on the second floor and very quiet at night. We will stay here again when in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of being assigned a smoking room with Priceline”
Reviews.Author: VickyE2006
Reviews.Content: Priceline considers this a 3 star (upscale) hotel located in the Warner Center/Woodland Hills area. The last time I bid on a 3 star hotel in Woodland Hills, I got the Marriott Warner Center. This motel should not be in the same class as the Marriott Warner Center. We were told at check in that Priceline had requested a smoking room and that they had no other available rooms. Since it was a 2 night stay, we asked if we could get a nonsmoking room on the second night. Again, we were told no. We went into the room and it REEKED of smoke. It was an expensive lesson, but I learned not to bid on 3 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomadations, cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Febeautiful
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I stayed at Staybridge, Chatsworth for summer vacation. We got a one bedroom, living rm and kitchen. It was very clean, beds very comfortable, free daily housekeeping service. The kitchen had all the necessary items to cook a warm meal all items in excellent condition. Free parking, delicious continental breakfast daily from 6:30-9:30am with a variety of warm and cold foods. They also have sundown every Tues, Wed, & Thurs from 5:30-6:30pm includes free wine & beer and each night is themed: Mexican, Italian, Hamburger night, etc. Excellent food my children ate very well through out our stay! There is also a pool & jacuzzi area with Bar-be-Que and many tables for sitting while enjoying the pool, free towels! To my surprise they have a 24 hour FREE laundry for guests open 24hours all you need is to provide your own soap and dirty clothes. At night there is a security guard and free parking. The complex itself is very secure and safe located in a remote part of L.A. 45 minutes from Universal Studios & downtown. Avoid driving the 101 HWY as it is very congested morning and night, best HWY to use is the 118 to 170 to 101 to get into town quickly. L.A. traffic can wear you down! Front desk staff is okay can be more friendly and outgoing to guests but besides that I plan on returning to Staybridge Suites soon! Excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge Service drops a bit”
Reviews.Author: CABozeman
Reviews.Content: As a person who has stayed at this hotel multiple times, I've had a chance to see its response to changing times. While it remains a pretty good deal(prices have risen in the last few trips), there is evidence of staff/service cutbacks under the new management co. Most noticeable is the service during the breakfast period. Where this was once staffed by multiple people keeping the coffee and food containers filled, now there is one, lone woman who really can't do it all. I expressed this to the staff at checkout. The food remains OK, but there needs to be more than one person on duty from 6:30-9:00. Room cleaning has also become more sparse, but that isn't a problem, per se. You can ask for more. All in all, I suggest more competitive rates and better food service. Still a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Very professional and freindly staff. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: jpanussi
Reviews.Content: Very professional, helpfull and friendly Manager, Sean Hashemi. You really feel at home and feel like extending your stay. I have been in several hotels and not felt like a home like this one. I highly recommand this hotel and give 5 star. You should try this one. Your pets are also very well come.

Reviews.Title: “They Really Try but Could do better”
Reviews.Author: Bribear
Reviews.Content: My love found this place thru hotwire and the price was great. We chose a 3rd floor room well off the street which was very quiet. The Plusses: Friendly and helpful staff. Best location for Chatsworth. Ample rooms. The suites were fully equipped. Large bathroom sink/ walk in closet area. The Minuses: Bathroom sink was stopped up---this should NEVER happen. Sitting room TV remote was not programed. Tiny toilet crammed next to tub/shower. The heater did not work. If you don't care about daily service, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - could not have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: EuropeaninAsia
Reviews.Content: Ria was extremely poilte, efficient and knew the area well - she could not have done more. Rooms were spotless with everything needed. Will most definitely stay here again. Other people commenting must have stayed somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not a safe area”
Reviews.Author: gbcue
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, both bid through Priceline, both times, I got a good deal, in relative terms. The service is okay, not phenomenal like at other hotels, who'd bend-over backwards to get you what you need. The first time, I got a room on the first floor, the second time, on the 2nd floor. The location of the hotel is terrible, in general. It's in the middle of nowhere, no places to walk to and looks like it's kind of in a bad place. You have to drive to get anywhere, but it's LA. The first time I stayed, my car got broken into. They did the least amount of effort to help me. They gave me the number for the police and lent me their shop-vac. They didn't give me any plastic wrap (that I'm sure the kitchen has tons of), and they didn't even bother refunding me the price of the room! The second time I stayed, it was okay, couldn't sleep because the last time I stayed. The rooms has a full kitchenette. The parking sucks, there aren't enough spaces for all rooms. They also make you sign a clause that says if you party, they can take all your money and kick you to the curb.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal if bidded on and booked through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: junie444
Reviews.Content: Although noted as a three star hotel, it is really an extended stay property. It's the first time I have been in an extended stay type of property. It is apartment like, you get a kitchen, living room, small bath and two desks, you get free fully cooked breakfast buffet in the morning and a simple dinner, wine, drinks Tuesday through Thursday. This helps cut costs for families traveling with children and after traveling for six weeks, mine were happy to see something that looked like an apartment. Free internet in the business center, free coffee/tea all day, free laundry and no parking fees really cut down the cost of traveling, particularly with children. BEWARE, although pet friendly, be warned, they charge $75 for three nights and $150 for six nights (almost three times the cost of the hotel rental if you got a deal on Priceline). Nowhere at the front desk does it say that there is a fee, particularly one that increases after three days to $150. When I was automatically charged this on check-out, I was assumed to know this. Day clerks are really nice, night staff is a bit grumpy, particularly Roy. This is east Chatsworth, not a gorgeous area, but near the mountains with a nice nightly breeze. It's worth it if you can get a deal bidding on a room through one of the sites, expensive if you pay their going rate of $160-170 a night. A nice alternative to a hotel though and with a separate living room/kitchen (with pullout couch) and double doors to the bedroom, it's a good place to share with someone. My kids loved it. Maintenance people are spyish. Oh, if using Netspend or debit cards, beware. Every couple of days a $50 charge is put through for your incidentals. With Netspend, It takes 20 days to get your incidental charges reversed you don't request that they fax a release to your debit card company, bank debit cards have their own policies. Bottom line, if you can get this room through priceline (the only 3 star hotel in their area other than the Radisson which is also an extended stay type) for $75-80, it's a pretty good deal. You have to go in to Woodland Hills for anything to do, about five miles away, tons of malls, theaters, restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: perryfamilyAZ
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, the front desk girl gave me the wrong room number. After multiple trips to the front desk to obtain new keys and having the maintence worker check the door, we found out the hotel room was already occupied! The poor lady was scared to death. The front desk girl wrote down the wrong room number. This hotel is dirty, located in a terrible location next to run down apartments and strip malls. The free breakfast was worse than Dennys. Don't stay here, I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: thedancelfamily
Reviews.Content: SEAN HASHEMI is the Operations Manager here and not only was he not friendly, but he had an-real attitude. The real problem is that this is a franchise location, so basically he knows the "buck" stops with him. The corporate office has no real power over franchises. We requested towels and they provided (2) for a family of (2) adults and (2) toddlers. Mr. Hashemi stated their independent policy is to provide (4) towels in the room and only (2) additional, until the used towels are collected. Are you serious? I have never heard of this type of policy. They put a hold on your credit card for damages, so do they really think people are going to run off with their (6) towels? It is obvious that his title is a cover for his holding as an owner. Next, their pert run area was full of dog waste, that had no been cleaned in days. Furthermore, they had wood that was laying in the area that had nails sticking out. I can go on further, but really it is a waste of time. I'm sticking with the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Decent suites, twilight zone experience”
Reviews.Author: MiraleLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: A month long stay reduced to two days and the worst experience I've ever had in business travel for the past twenty years. The terms were never honored, I was bullied to leave and threatened when I complained. Very bizarre staff, definitely not for children. Owned by the Intercontinental group which oddly won a customer service award last year. I'd never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: angelbear55
Reviews.Content: I have just read some of the reviews on here and am totally upset by some of them that sad this place is filthy and bad service. This hotel is EXCELLENT and very clean. I am a disabled traveler who is in a wheelchair and when my room was booked by a production company,I was not booked into a wheelchair accessible room (not the hotels fault) Upon checking in and going to my room, I noticed it was not an accessible room and called the front desk. They were actually sold out of accessible rooms but the manager called me right back and said one of the rooms occupant was advised of my problem and was wlling to change rooms with me. The room was VERY clean, the service was EXTRODINARY.. The "sundown service" on Tues, Wed, and Thursday nights were good. The food was avg but filling. The buffet breakfast every morning was wonderful. Take my word for it. It is an EXCELLENT property, clean (as of matter of fact, the carpets were steam cleaned while I was there, as were the drapes,and furniture) I highly recommend this pproperty.

Reviews.Title: “Is this what assisted living is like?”
Reviews.Author: Gypsytraveler09
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 93 year old grandmother, my handicapped dad, my mom and my 8 year old son to visit The Getty Center and The Villa. Finding somewhere to stay was a chore due to the vast difference in ages and needs. With some trepidation concerning travel time between destinations, I chose the Staybridge Suites more because of the conversation I had with the desk clerk, Patricia than anything else. She was so sweet and helpful and put up with my multiple phone calls and answered any question that I came up. She even made sure that we had a 2 bedroom queen suite on the ground floor so that we didn't have to worry about navigating any uneven surfaces or stairs. After I made the reservations I started to worry if I had done the right thing renting a room so far away from The Villa, it turns out that I did exactly the right thing. Chatsworth was about 30 minutes or less from The Getty Center. There are tons of great places to eat on Ventura Blvd and on North Topanga Canyon Drive as well as two of the best malls on the way to the Staybridge Suites that The Valley has to offer. In the morning we drove straight out Topanga Canyon and including a short wait for road work we were in Santa Monica in a little over 30 minutes. The suite had two bathrooms, full kitchen, large bedrooms, with a common living room. there were three large desks in the suites and each room had its own T.V. with honest to God T.V. stations, not some hotel station that asks you buy cable. Nice, clean, thick towels, nice bedding all the goods. The price of the room also included a full breakfast and a sundown beer and wine bar where a light meal was served. We sat around the pool while my son swam and enjoyed the evening with other hotel guests. There was actually a masseuse giving FREE massages to the guests! What? It's true. The staff was so nice and friendly that even the guests were calm and happy. Not one rude word. Not one raised voice. Imagine that. Seems like a long time since I've been anywhere without someone asserting themselves. Sigh. Yep, I will stay here again and never, ever, ever stay in Beverly Hill or Santa Monica again. This place is too well situated and the neighborhoods are quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites after renovation....but paperthin walls”
Reviews.Author: LAKen2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Staybridge after booking a room through Priceline at $50 per night. Room was very clean and quite spacious. Nice brunch included in price. Friendly staff persons who actually called me at my room to ask me how everything was so far. Free high-speed internet. My only complaint is that you can hear everything from your adjoining neighbor's walls. My neighbor had his t.v. on all night long. I called the front desk and they sent security to his room quickly. Sure enough, I could clearly hear security knock on his door and hear him say, "hello, hello?" He did turn down the t.v. for awhile but in about an hr., turned it back up. In all fairness to Staybridge, I am a light sleeper and they did try to get him to quiet down. I can't imagine what the noise would have been like if this person had decided to have a party at his room! If they added insulation to the walls, this would be the perfect place to stay! Bring your white noise machine, if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, Ugly Lies”
Reviews.Author: lawyergirl07
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on Priceline and scored at $50.00 a night! Woo Hoo...more drinkin money for the Cowboy Palace (an awesome Honky Tonk bar a few blocks away). I arrived at the hotel lobby around 6pm and was greeted by the Hotel Desk Supervisor and another friendly young lady. Check-in was a breeze. Quick. Easy. Painless. The Superviser advised me that there would be a $50 hold on my credit card for incidentals. Pretty standard. I informed her that I may be extending my stay one more night. I was very clear in asking if another $50 charge would be applied to my card for the second day. She CLEARLY stated that the orginal charge would be held over for the next day if I informed the front desk before 11am. I explained to her that with the amount that I travel, I already have about $550 in holds from hotels waiting to be cleared and I needed to avoid any more. She laughed and assured me that I would be charged only that once. Well, I opted to extend my stay another night and called up the front desk. The call was answered by a very rude guy. I told him I had extended my stay. He told me that I needed to bring my ID and credit card to the front desk. Uhhhh...ok...why? Apparently, because it was a different transaction on Priceline he needed to charge the card again. I was upset and told him that I didnt appreciate the different stories. He got sharp with me and said "Thats just the way it is." I was clearly pissed off and may or may not have said something really mean back (tee hee). THEN, to make matters worse, they outsource the housekeeping to an outside company, so I wasnt even able to get housekeeping to come and give me new towels or to empty the trash. Will I stay here again, yes, more than likely. The hotel rooms are like little apartments and its really close to my Family's house. All I can hope is the little grouchy dude at the front desk gets run off or something.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: snsdmt
Reviews.Content: i was a little apprehensive coming to this hotel based on some of the reviews I read. boy was I surprised! this hotel is fantastic. The staff were all very friendly and accomedating. The room was VERY clean and much bigger than I was expecting. I booked my room through Priceline for a great price...$60! I was thrilled with my stay here and would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Still needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: ValleyMom
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review of this hotel in March of 2007. I had hoped to find, during my recent stay, that some improvements had been made to the property since then. Sadly, that's not been the case. This property is really showing its age. The rooms need a complete overhaul, starting with the carpeting which is still absolutely FILTHY. My family's socks were blackened from walking on it. Several times during our stay we were woken in the middle of the night by a clunking-type sound that originated from the fridge -- that was annoying. Overall, the place (probably because of its age) just seems dirty. New paint inside the rooms would help, as would fixing cracked bathroom floor tiles and such. Most disturbing (though not the hotel's fault) was when, at 9 p.m. on a Saturday night, a rowdy group of people toting cases of beer began pounding on our room door demanding to be let in. Obviously they had the wrong room (though they weren't inclined to believe us, at first), but it just proves that the property is being used as a party place, of sorts, by some of its guests. Because we visited over the weekend, no maid service of any kind was provided. So we had to be very thoughtful of how many towels we were using and how dirty things got, etc. I'll likely stay at this property again in the future but only because of its close proximity to friends and family in the area, and other lodging choices are limited -- but not because I actually enjoy staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: HoustonDavid
Reviews.Content: In more than 20 years of travel for business and vacations, I have never experienced anything like the terrible service I received at this hotel. There were more problems than I imagined could be possible in a four day stay. The management was incompetent and the staff unresponsive. I would stay in my rental car before I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst guest treatment I have ever received”
Reviews.Author: travel5family
Reviews.Content: This was the third time that my family and I stayed at this hotel. In the two previous visits I was pleased with their basic and reliable amenities of an extended stay. This time I received the worst treatment as a hotel guest I have ever experienced. Basically my family and I were suddenly shortchanged in our stay in order to accomodate some other hotel guest of "higher priority" for the management. I guess they just hoped that I wouldn't notice or that I wouldn't care that one day into the reservation the level of comfort of our stay had drastically diminished. What followed was a series of sixteen lies (yes, I counted) by the two managers at the front desk in order to cover up what they had done. Eventurally, the operations manager apologized profusedly and gave me points on my frequent stay card and 20% off on our NEXT stay (which we will not be using). This was not the way to get me to come back, but may be that was the point. By the end, it was pointed out to me how much the front desk managers felt they had gone out of their way in order to make things right AFTER I pointed out that they had lied repeatedly and made our pre-Christmas day miserable. The entire management staff needs some serious training on accountability, customer relations, and communication among staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: spach
Reviews.Content: I loved the Staybridge suites at Chatsworth, definitely worth the money. The carpet was not as clean as I would have liked (I had a toddler) but when I called the front desk they had housekeeping come in immediately and shampoo the carpet. The breakfast buffet was great. Overall a very pleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “No thanks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2004. Yuck. Neighborhood where this hotel is located seemed very shady. Buildings were rundown and had bars on their windows. Would not recommend walking far at night. We asked for an upstairs room and received one on ground floor facing the dumpsters of a fast food place (door is to the outside, like a motel). Did not complain as we were staying only one night. Room was okay. Plenty of space with kitchen area but reminded us of a Super 8. Again, shady. No decent restaurants in the area but found a few chain places near mall a few miles away. Staff was okay but did not really ask them for anything. Included simple breakfast with typical toast and cereal, average but not bad. Overall, would not recommend and would not stay there again.
